info.title: Information
info.description: This application monitors SSH connections to the system and sends Telegram notifications when it detects a new access.
info.requirements: To use this application, you need to:
steps: Create a Telegram bot using BotFather and get the token
Get the chat ID where you want to receive notifications (can be your personal ID or a group ID)
Enter this data in the configuration form above
Test the connection to verify everything works correctly
features: SSH Monitoring - Detects and notifies SSH connections
Docker Management - Control Docker containers via Telegram
File Upload - Upload files to server via Telegram
System Resources - View CPU, RAM, disk and network
Alert System - Parameter monitoring with automatic notifications

bot_messages.welcome:
Welcome to Server Monitor Bot!

This bot allows you to monitor your server status and receive notifications when important events are detected such as SSH access or high resource usage.

Use /res to check current server status
Use /help to see all available commands
bot_messages.help:
Available commands:

/start - Start the bot
/help - Show this help message
/res - Display system resources
/docker - Manage Docker containers
/upload - Upload files to server
/download - Download files from server
/reboot - Restart server (requires confirmation)
bot_messages.reboot_confirm:
Are you sure you want to restart the server?

This action will cause a temporary interruption of all services.
bot_messages.reboot_in_progress:
Server restart in progress...

The server will be restarted. This operation may take several minutes.
The bot will be temporarily unavailable until the restart is complete.
